meanings.definition: Yexes (verb): to utter a loud, sharp cry or yell
meanings.sent1: When the cat saw the mouse, it yexes loudly.
meanings.sent2: The child yexes when he is scared.
meanings.sent3: The baby yexes in delight when she sees her favorite toy.
meanings.sent4: The alarm clock yexes loudly, waking me up abruptly.
meanings.sent5: The warrior yexes a battle cry before charging into the fight.

meanings.definition: Yexes (noun): a loud, sharp cry or yell
meanings.sent1: The yexes of the baby echoed through the house.
meanings.sent2: The yexes of the crowd could be heard from far away.
meanings.sent3: The yexes of the monkey made everyone laugh at the zoo.
meanings.sent4: The yexes of the thunderstorm shook the windows.
meanings.sent5: The yexes of the singer captivated the audience.
